# NSScriptWhoseTest

**Class**

An abstract class that provides the basis for testing specifiers one at a time or in groups.

## Declaration

```swift
class NSScriptWhoseTest
```

## Overview

`NSScriptWhoseTest` is an abstract class whose sole method is [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSScriptWhoseTest/isTrue()]. Two concrete subclasses of `NSScriptWhoseTest` generate objects representing Boolean expressions comparing one object with another and objects representing multiple Boolean expressions connected by logical operators (`OR`, `AND`, `NOT`). These classes are, respectively, [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSSpecifierTest] and [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSLogicalTest]. In evaluating itself, an [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSWhoseSpecifier] invokes the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSScriptWhoseTest/isTrue()] method of its “test” object.

You shouldn’t need to subclass `NSScriptWhoseTest`, and you should rarely need to subclass one of its subclasses.

## Evaluating a test

- **isTrue()**: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the test represented by the receiver evaluates to true.

## Initializers

- **init()**
- **init(coder:)**

## Object Matching Tests

- **NSSpecifierTest**: A comparison between an object specifier and a test object.
- **NSLogicalTest**: The logical combination of one or more specifier tests.

## Inherits From

- NSObject

## Inherited By

- NSLogicalTest
- NSSpecifierTest

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSCoding
- NSObjectProtocol
